decision_conditions:
All new development, unless otherwise shown on the approved drawings, in respect of all the works hereby approved (and any other incidental works to be carried out in this connection) shall match the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance.


REASON: In the interests of visual amenity.

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-3b7b07de-7fff-81a5-e694-15b7984b5a5d"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:6pt;"><span style="font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Arial;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Prior to superstructure works, detailed specification, a drainage layout and a management &amp; maintenance plan (where applicable) of at least one suitable sustainable drainage system (i.e. water butt with overflow, raingarden, bioretention planter box, living roof (substrate depth of 80-150mm excluding the vegetative mat), permeable paving etc.) shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the LLFA. If soakaways i.e. plastic modules and soakaway rings are used, an infiltration test must be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume.</span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:6pt;"><span style="font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Arial;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Reason: To mitigate against the effects of flooding and to comply with Policy LP53 of the Hackney Local Plan (LP33)</span></p>

<p>The development hereby approved shall provide two swift boxes close to the eaves prior to first occupation and shall be retained as such in perpetuity.</p><p>REASON: In the interest of biodiversity</p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.
description: Erection of single-storey side/rear extension; Alterations to fenestrations including replacement door and visual screening at loft floor level, replacement window within the front dormer, and insertion of window in side elevation; Installation of refuse storage; Installation of solar panels across front and rear roof slopes; Insertion of rear rooflight; Removal of chimney; Lowering of ground-level in front garden
